title: Citi Named Euromoney's Best Bank in Asia
summary: Hong Kong - Citi has been awarded the title of Best Bank in Asia by the editors of Euromoney magazine. Citi also picked up best Cash Management Bank in Asia, Best Investment Bank in Indonesia and Best Equity House in India. The awards were announced in Hong Kong on July 12.
tag-1: Citi Named Euromoney's Best Bank in Asia
tag-2: Hong Kong – Citi has been awarded the title of Best Bank in Asia by the editors of Euromoney magazine. Citi also picked up best Cash Management Bank in Asia, Best Investment Bank in Indonesia and Best Equity House in India. The awards were announced in Hong Kong on July 12.
tag-3: The editors of Euromoney said, "Citi's leading place comes thanks to the contribution of Asia to overall bank revenues and the bank's diversified approach to building its business. Citi's Asia business contributed an eye-catching 37 percent to global net group profits."
tag-4: For the cash management award, the editors said: "Citi regains the cash award...thanks to another year of innovation in transaction services. Citi was the clear leader among foreign banks in nearly all countries across the region."
tag-5: The award process is increasingly more competitive, and for Citi to continue to win the best bank award is a reflection of Citi's continued commitment, growth and investment in Asia. Citi retains the award from 2011.
tag-6: In the last 12 months, Citi raised more than US$150 billion for Asia Pacific clients from the capital markets, according to Dealogic data. In the last year, the bank also announced plans to commence a local securities JV in China and that it was the first global bank to get approval to launch sole-branded credit cards in China.
tag-7: "This is great recognition of the talent and client focus of our team at Citi all across the region. We are delighted to receive these awards from Euromoney magazine, especially as it comes as we celebrate our 200th anniversary. We want to extend our sincere thanks to all our clients in Asia Pacific who place their trust in us and are the reason for our continued success," said Stephen Bird, CEO for Citi Asia Pacific.
tag-8: Euromoney is one of the world's leading monthly financial magazines. The awards are part of the Euromoney Awards for Excellence 2012. The annual awards set the standards for banking and capital market excellence amongst the top-ranking financial institutions around the world.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
